SENT.plain: We report on a rare case of a patient with rhinocerebral mucormycosis that presented as intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH)
A 54-year-old man who was immunosuppressed had ophthalmoplegia
Four days later, ICH developed in his left frontal lobe
The ICH was surgically removed totally
Pathology specimen surgically obtained from brain surface adjacent to hematoma cavity showed blood vessels filled with Mucor mycelium
Combined with surgical findings, venous occlusion by Mucor mycelium might be the cause of ICH in the patient
